description.hltext_display: Garuda Indonesia Introduces New Boeing 737-800NG On KL-Jakarta Route
description.content: KUALA LUMPUR, Dec 22 (Bernama) -- Indonesia's national airline, Garuda Indonesia, will operate the new Boeing 737-800 Next Generation (738NG) aircraft on the Kuala Lumpur-Jakarta route starting January 15 next year. It will be featuring the carrier's 'Nature's Wing' livery, signature interior and upgraded on-board services. The new aircraft comfortably seats 156 passengers in a two-class configuration, said Garuda. Compared to the current fleet of aircraft servicing the route, the new 738NGs will significantly increase the airline's capacity by up to 40 per cent. The technologically advanced 738NG aircraft also features individual touch-screen LCD TVs throughout Executive and Economy Classes with Video on Demand (VOD) entertainment systems offering 25 feature films and 25 audio tracks. "We decided to deploy the new aircraft on this route because of the steady increase in demand," Garuda Indonesia's general manager for Malaysia, Erwin Suharja said in a statement here, Wednesday. Garuda Indonesia's flights from Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta are popular with the business and golfing community because of convenient flight timings and value added services, the airline said. The airline currently offers two flights daily from Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta. Effective also from January 15, travellers can easily do a day trip either for business or a round of golf in many of Jakarta's scenic courses by taking the 8am flight to Jakarta and returning on the 5.10pm flight (Jakarta time). -- BERNAMA

event_or_fact.property: We decided to deploy the new aircraft on this route because of the steady increase in demand
general manager for Malaysia, Garuda Indonesia

description.hltext_display: Accord Europe/Etats-Unis sur les crédits export à l'aéronautique
description.content:
PARIS (Reuters) - Le nouvel accord international sur les crédits export à l'aéronautique, finalisé vendredi à Paris après plusieurs mois de négociations au sein de l'OCDE, a été approuvé mardi par les Etats-Unis, rapportent mercredi Les Echos.
Cet accord vise à rétablir l'équilibre entre les compagnies des pays exportateurs d'avions et leurs concurrents des pays tiers, tout en protégeant les exportations d'Airbus, filiale d'EADS, et de Boeing, écrit le quotidien.
Malgré quelques demandes américaines de dernière minute, le texte final, applicable à partir du 1er février, reste néanmoins conforme au compromis négocié la semaine dernière, précise le journal.
"Cependant, comme le demandaient Airbus et Boeing, cet accord prévoit une période de transition durant laquelle un certain nombre d'avions continueront à échapper à cette hausse des primes", poursuivent Les Echos.
"Ce sera le cas pour tous les appareils commandés avant le 31 décembre et livrés avant fin 2012, ainsi que pour 69 Boeing et autant d'Airbus commandés avant 2007 et qui continueront à bénéficier de taux encore plus bas que les conditions actuelles."
Alexandre Boksenbaum-Granier, édité par Dominique Rodriguez

description.hltext_display: PSOE Lorca exige apertura nuevo centro parkinson, terminado desde septiembre
description.content:
Lorca, 22 dic (EFE).- El PSOE en Lorca ha exigido hoy al ayuntamiento la apertura y puesta en servicio del nuevo centro de día para enfermos de parkinson, ya que las obras de acondicionamiento terminaron el pasado septiembre.
El candidato a la alcaldía por el PSOE, Manuel Soler, ha recordado que el local, situado en al calle Río Guadalentín, será gestionado por la Asociación Lorquina de Enfermos de Parkinson, y que en marzo comenzaron las reformas del mismo para eliminar las barreras arquitectónicas que presentaba.
Soler ha recordado también que el consistorio se comprometió a concluir los trabajos en un plazo de dos meses, por lo que hace siete meses que el local debía estar prestando servicio.
El candidato socialista ha considerado que sería "muy grave" que el equipo de Gobierno estuviera dilatando la apertura del local para acercarla a la convocatoria de elecciones municipales.
El político del PSOE ha demandado la apertura inmediata del local y ha pedido que primen los intereses de los afectados por esta enfermedad por encima de los intereses electorales.EFE 1010091

description.hltext_display: 55岁低保女子收留五名低保户
description.content:
《低保女人收留了五个低保户 走丢一个 快帮找找》接续报道
新闻回放：
10日9时，许桂芬收留的老人孙相荣吃完早饭后就走丢了。老人61岁，曾患有脑出血，且半身不遂，无儿无女。孙相荣仅仅是许桂芬收养老人中的一个，55岁的许桂芬共收养了5个人，并且他们都是低保户，日子一直过得很拮据……
本报讯 “寻找走失老人孙相荣”的新闻让我们认识了一位普通却不平凡的女人――许桂芬，一年来，她接连收留了5位处境窘迫的低保户住进自己的家，而年过半百的她本身也只是一个低保户。一间平房，两个小屋，住着许桂芬一家。这个家庭里，除了老母亲，其他5个人原本和许桂芬素不相识，能走到同一个屋檐下，都源自许大姐的好心肠……
平凡的女人看不得别人受苦
54岁的许桂芬早年离婚，一个人拉扯儿子，还要照顾母亲，日子过得不容易，她见不得别人受苦，她最多时收留过5个有实际困难的人。谢全义夫妇是许桂芬收留的两口子，他们原本是许桂芬的邻居，老谢的媳妇患有轻度智障。去年冬天，许桂芬路过老谢家，看到的一幕让她心头发酸。许大姐说，一进老谢的家，只见他家的房子漏着大洞，屋里已住不了，在被窝里焐的饭都冻得梆硬。看到老谢的难处，许桂芬把夫妻俩接到了自己家，住进了暖屋子，吃上了热乎饭，老谢两口子把许桂芬当成恩人看待。今年春节前夕，去社区领取低保金的许桂芬又听说了一件事：有个人没地儿去，一直在锅炉房里蹲着，许桂芬并不认识这个人，但在许桂芬看来，这个人也非常可怜，没人收养，许桂芬就把这位蹲锅炉房的老人领回了家。
悉心照料收留的老人
许桂芬领回家的老人正是孙相荣，许桂芬说，多年在外流浪，让孙相荣落下了一身病。但她没多想，就把他接进了自己家。孙相荣刚被接回家时，脸上烂得都是疮，坐下就哗哗来一大堆尿，无奈之下许桂芬只能给孙相荣买来成人用的尿不湿。但孙相荣的到来，彻底打乱了许家人的生活，孙相荣不仅生活不能自理，还时常会迷路走失，不得已，许桂芬找到了孙家二姐商量对
策。但孙相荣的姐姐表示这个患病的弟弟实在是没地儿去，说着说着姐俩拉着手都哭了。见到此景，心软的许桂芬再也看不下去了，就留下了孙相荣，老人在一屋人的细心照料下，干净利索了不说，也学会了体谅。
别人非议女儿 母亲鸣不平
家里突然多了两口人后，让许桂芬一家人的生活更是难上加难，但在贫困面前，许桂芬没有丝毫退却，并且又收留了一位老人和一个残疾女子，而一段时间之后，两人在联系上家人后被接走。许桂芬说，最多时她家的小屋里住进了7个人。在这个小屋里一起生活，素不相识的陌生人也变得亲如一家。此时，一种叫做责任的东西，也悄悄地爬上了她的肩头。
许桂芬说，几个人把低保金交给了自己，来维持日常开销，但这样的举动，却给她惹来了非议。有人传言：许桂芬是看上了别人的低保，才把外人招进家门。这一次，许桂芬的老母亲忍不住了，开口为女儿鸣不平。“家里也没个男的，孩子身体也不好，我姑娘受这么大苦，难道就是为了那点低保金吗？”许桂芬的母亲说。在老母亲眼中，女儿就是家里的“顶梁柱”，从小性格就要强，许母不愿让女儿再受苦受累还受委屈。面对母亲的劝说，许桂芬嘴上依了老妈，可她心里早已决定，她无论何时，遇到什么状况，都不会放弃家里的这些新成员，“苦就苦我一个人吧！”是许桂芬常说的一句话。
与“家人”的情谊难以割舍
孙相荣走丢后，许桂芬拼命地寻找，而当找到孙相荣的喜讯传来时，许桂芬流下了幸福的眼泪，在许桂芬看来如果孙相荣真的走丢了，那么除了肩上那份责任外，更让她难以割舍的则是这一年来与老人的情感。在孙相荣被找到的第三天，他身体已经明显好转，一提起许桂芬对自己的好，老人只是哭个不停。虽然生活很贫寒，但生活还要继续。许桂芬说，无论未来生活怎样，她都会脚踏实地做个实在人，对得起良心，对得起自己，将来还会坚持下去，让更多无家可归的人感受到家的温暖，可能这个家不是很富裕，但这里却充满爱！

description.hltext_display: Bergen Regional Med Center cutting up to 50 jobs
description.content:
Bergen Regional Medical Center said Tuesday that it will eliminate "less than 50 positions" as a result of federal and state reimbursement reductions for charity care and a prohibition against entering into contracts with managed health care providers.
Donnalee Corrieri, a spokeswoman for the Bergen Regional LP, a division of Solomon health management of Colorado, said in a statement that "no direct patient hospital services have been eliminated," but she declined to provide a specific number of positions or comment on what types of jobs would be cut at the Paramus hospital.
Corrieri placed partial blame for the layoffs with the hospital's title-holder, the Bergen County Improvement Authority, for not allowing it to "enter into managed-care contracts, adding more financial challenges to an already difficult reimbursement environment."
Keith Furlong, the spokesman for the improvement authority, said in a press release that Philip Wilson, the authority's new chairman, did not learn of the layoff plan until Tuesday morning.
Furlong said the hospital's management had also submitted its budget Tuesday morning — "after repeated requests" — and that the budget showed that the company continues to make a profit.
Without having managed-care contracts with private health insurance providers, hospitals typically have a more difficult time attracting patients who are privately insured, and thus tend to serve a larger proportion of less-affluent patients who are publicly insured through Medicaid and Medicare.
"Bergen Regional Medical Center, being a safety net hospital and one of the largest providers of charity care in the state, has provided medical and mental health care services to an increased number of patients without insurance while experiencing significant, multimillion-dollar reductions in reimbursements for treatment of indigent and uninsured patients," Corrieri said in the press release.
Furlong said the BCIA "cannot arbitrarily create another full-service, managed-care hospital without careful thought and review."
"Managed care is one of many topics we have tried to settle with BRMC," Furlong said in his press release.
"However, given the mission of the hospital is to be a safety net, opening up another full-service hospital in the area may jeopardize the care received by those who need it the most and can't afford to go to [Hackensack University Medical Center], Englewood [Hospital and Medical Center] or other area hospitals."
Furlong urged the company to open its books to the public and to use some of its profits to avert the layoffs.
A spokeswoman for the Health Professional and Allied Employees union said the layoffs represent about $8 million in cuts.
Jeanne Otersen, the statewide policy director for the union, noted that while Bergen Regional is privately managed, it is still publicly owned, and that the hospital should be more forthcoming with details.
"What is the impact on patients?" she said. "Are these management positions? Are these patient-care positions? Are these housekeeping positions? The lack of information is as disturbing as these cuts."

description.hltext_display: American Airlines Pulls Fares From Orbitz
description.content:
American Airlines pulled its flights from the Orbitz travel website on Tuesday in a dispute that could eventually affect the way travelers buy airplane tickets online.
The airline said its tickets sold previously on Orbitz are still valid. And American Airlines tickets can still be bought at the airline's own website as well as other travel websites. American pulled its tickets from the Orbitz for Business site as well.
The dispute is the latest sign of strains between airlines and the companies that sell airline tickets, including online sellers like Orbitz.
Airlines have traditionally paid sellers a commission. American also pays fees to the global distribution companies that provide the flight information.
Now, American wants Orbitz to get that flight information directly from the airline, cutting out the global distribution systems. American has said that will reduce costs and also allow it to make more personalized offers to customers such as hotels and car rentals.
The global distribution systems have not moved as fast as they could have to upgrade their technology, but American's move with Orbitz is "rather severe," said Henry Harteveldt, a travel analyst for Forrester Research. "It seems like they want to scorch the earth."
He predicted that travelers who want to fly on American will seek out its tickets on the airline's website. Travelers who don't know what happened with Orbitz, or don't care which airline they fly, are unlikely to notice American's absence from Orbitz, he said.
Traveler advocates have said American's move will make it harder to comparison shop.
"There is profit in confusion, there is profit in fragmentation of all the fares and the fees so consumers can't comparison shop," said Kevin Mitchell, chairman of the Business Travel Coalition, which represents corporate travel buyers.
He said airlines ultimately would like to flip the current financial arrangement around and have travel agents pay them for access to flight information, rather than American paying every time someone else sells a ticket on one of its flights.
American's vice president for sales, Derek DeCross, said in a statement that the airline needs to be "free to customize its product offerings to improve the customer experience as well as distribute its products in a way that does not result in unnecessary costs."
American had threatened to pull out of Orbitz on Dec. 1. But Orbitz got a state court judge in Chicago to block the threat temporarily. It made its move on Tuesday shortly after judge Martin S. Agran declined to issue an injunction. Agran ruled that any breach of contract can be sorted out with a lawsuit later.
The request to block American was brought by privately held Travelport Ltd., which owns 48 percent of Orbitz. It also runs two of the biggest so-called global distribution systems, Galileo and Worldspan. American spokesman Ryan Mikolasik said it has been negotiating with other online ticket sellers. The Orbitz negotiation was made more difficult because of Travelport's involvement as owner of the two global distribution systems, he said.
Orbitz Worldwide Inc. called American's decision "unfortunate" and said it still offers flights from more than 400 airlines worldwide and would continue to seek a way to sell American tickets, too. It said American Airlines tickets add-ons like rental cars and hotel rooms added up to about 5 percent of the company's revenue for the nine months that ended Sept. 30. It said it believes that any American Airlines tickets it loses will be replaced by tickets on other airlines.
Shares of American parent AMR Corp. rose 14 cents to close at $8.05. Orbitz shares rose 22 cents, or 3.5 percent, to close at $6.44, but then fell 16 cents, or 2.5 percent, to $6.28 in aftermarket trading.
Also Tuesday, Delta Air Lines Inc. said it would stop selling tickets through three smaller travel websites, CheapOAir.com, OneTravel.com, and BookIt.com effective on Dec. 17.
Last week a Delta executive told analysts that some ticket venues have more value than others. The airline wants "as direct a relationship and channel to our best customers as we can," said Glenn Hauenstein, Delta's executive vice president for network planning, revenue management, and marketing. He said he's aiming for Delta's own website to be more like an Apple store and suggested that other travel websites are more like Best Buy, with similar products, but a different customer experience, he said.
___
Freed reported from Minneapolis. AP Airlines Writer David Koenig in Dallas contributed to this report.

description.hltext_display: Holiday stresses call for a look within
description.content:
"Whether it's food, alcohol, shopping, sex or whatever the addiction is, we're looking for a way of escaping stress because the intensity of the present is so difficult."
KIRSTIN LYON, LICENSED MARRIAGE AND FAMILY THERAPIST
Crystal Stromer remembers most of the holiday gatherings she's attended in the same way: rushing in and immediately pouring a glass of wine before reaching for the hors d'oeuvres.
"I always felt stressed out," said the Pacific Grove, Calif., resident, recounting the string of questions that would run through her mind. "Did I get enough done? Am I wearing the right outfit? Did I buy the right gift? Instead of being present with the people, I would grab a glass of wine and get something to eat. Maybe that helped to quiet the stress."
Top holiday stressor
Stromer isn't alone. Between pressures to spend lavishly on gifts, rushing around to multiple holiday gatherings, entertaining hoards of out-of-town guests (or traveling through hoards to visit loved ones in another town), most Americans are familiar with the stress of the holiday season. Add to that the economic woes of 2010, and the pressure is higher still.
According to an American Psychological Association survey, 61 percent of Americans cite a lack of money as their top holiday stressor this season.
And, like Stromer, many people deal with their stressful feelings by soothing themselves with food or alcoholic beverages. In the same APA survey, 36 percent of Americans reported that they either eat food or drink alcohol to relieve their holiday stress.
This year, though, is different for Stromer. Not only was this the first Thanksgiving where she stopped eating when her stomach was full and declined reaching for another glass of wine, but as the Christmas parties start to roll around, she finds herself feeling more focused on the presence of other people at the gatherings. The difference isn't a new diet or changed holiday scene — the difference is in the way she feels about herself.
In her third month of attending a Body Love Group Coaching session facilitated by life coach Lily Hills, Stromer has learned to become more present with herself and how she's feeling.
"What I'm noticing is that my habits are really changing. Before reaching for the food for the wrong reasons, I ask myself: Are you really hungry, or are you sad or frustrated or stressed or just bored?"
"We're so used to seeking short-term pleasure rather than dealing with our pain," said Hills, author of "The Body Love Manual." "When we're feeding our emotional appetites, we're eating not because we're physically hungry, but because we're trying to cope with our feelings. Food becomes a coping mechanism."
Though numbing feelings with overeating or intoxication can make a person feel better in the short term, Hills pointed out that using food or alcohol in a compulsive way creates a vicious cycle that results in a person feeling worse, while the problems that drive the behavior are still there.
"Whether it's food, alcohol, shopping, sex or whatever the addiction is, we're looking for a way of escaping stress because the intensity of the present is so difficult," said Kirstin Lyon, licensed marriage and family therapist who specializes in counseling people with eating disorders.
"People use food to try to control the situation. Either they overeat to calm themselves, or they control their food intake by not eating when they should. Food gives them [a feeling of] control over all these other things they can't control — relationships, money. The reality is it's not giving control at all. It's a facade."
People with addictions aren't the only ones triggered by holiday stressors, clinical psychologist Lee Larimer says. "It's the case for all of us. We tend to have such huge expectations about how it's supposed to be and how it's supposed to feel, how friends and family are supposed to treat us — and many times these expectations are not realized. People put tremendous stress on themselves. When their expectations are not met, people tend to feel a sense of loss and inadequacy."
It turns out that lowering our expectations for the season may be one of the most effective strategies for a peaceful holiday experience.
"One thing I do is try to keep it simple," said Judith Wolfe, a licensed clinical social worker in private practice in Carmel and Salinas, Calif.
"It's not all about being done or being done perfectly. If you don't get the cookies done, buy the cookies. If you find yourself with five errands, let yourself triage. Do what has to be done now versus what can be done later. If you don't get it all done, just say, 'Oh well. It's all good.' "
To simplify gift-giving, Wolfe recommends starting a "Secret Santa" tradition or drawing a name. That way, you can focus on a thoughtful gift for one person rather than burning yourself out buying gifts for too many people. In addition, she said it's important that people sit down and decide on a financial limit for how much they want to spend — and then stick to it.
"Whether it's food, alcohol, shopping, sex or whatever the addiction is, we're looking for a way of escaping stress because the intensity of the present is so difficult."
KIRSTIN LYON, LICENSED MARRIAGE AND FAMILY THERAPIST
Crystal Stromer remembers most of the holiday gatherings she's attended in the same way: rushing in and immediately pouring a glass of wine before reaching for the hors d'oeuvres.
"I always felt stressed out," said the Pacific Grove, Calif., resident, recounting the string of questions that would run through her mind. "Did I get enough done? Am I wearing the right outfit? Did I buy the right gift? Instead of being present with the people, I would grab a glass of wine and get something to eat. Maybe that helped to quiet the stress."
Top holiday stressor
Stromer isn't alone. Between pressures to spend lavishly on gifts, rushing around to multiple holiday gatherings, entertaining hoards of out-of-town guests (or traveling through hoards to visit loved ones in another town), most Americans are familiar with the stress of the holiday season. Add to that the economic woes of 2010, and the pressure is higher still.
According to an American Psychological Association survey, 61 percent of Americans cite a lack of money as their top holiday stressor this season.
And, like Stromer, many people deal with their stressful feelings by soothing themselves with food or alcoholic beverages. In the same APA survey, 36 percent of Americans reported that they either eat food or drink alcohol to relieve their holiday stress.
This year, though, is different for Stromer. Not only was this the first Thanksgiving where she stopped eating when her stomach was full and declined reaching for another glass of wine, but as the Christmas parties start to roll around, she finds herself feeling more focused on the presence of other people at the gatherings. The difference isn't a new diet or changed holiday scene — the difference is in the way she feels about herself.
In her third month of attending a Body Love Group Coaching session facilitated by life coach Lily Hills, Stromer has learned to become more present with herself and how she's feeling.
"What I'm noticing is that my habits are really changing. Before reaching for the food for the wrong reasons, I ask myself: Are you really hungry, or are you sad or frustrated or stressed or just bored?"
"We're so used to seeking short-term pleasure rather than dealing with our pain," said Hills, author of "The Body Love Manual." "When we're feeding our emotional appetites, we're eating not because we're physically hungry, but because we're trying to cope with our feelings. Food becomes a coping mechanism."
Though numbing feelings with overeating or intoxication can make a person feel better in the short term, Hills pointed out that using food or alcohol in a compulsive way creates a vicious cycle that results in a person feeling worse, while the problems that drive the behavior are still there.
"Whether it's food, alcohol, shopping, sex or whatever the addiction is, we're looking for a way of escaping stress because the intensity of the present is so difficult," said Kirstin Lyon, licensed marriage and family therapist who specializes in counseling people with eating disorders.
"People use food to try to control the situation. Either they overeat to calm themselves, or they control their food intake by not eating when they should. Food gives them [a feeling of] control over all these other things they can't control — relationships, money. The reality is it's not giving control at all. It's a facade."
People with addictions aren't the only ones triggered by holiday stressors, clinical psychologist Lee Larimer says. "It's the case for all of us. We tend to have such huge expectations about how it's supposed to be and how it's supposed to feel, how friends and family are supposed to treat us — and many times these expectations are not realized. People put tremendous stress on themselves. When their expectations are not met, people tend to feel a sense of loss and inadequacy."
It turns out that lowering our expectations for the season may be one of the most effective strategies for a peaceful holiday experience.
"One thing I do is try to keep it simple," said Judith Wolfe, a licensed clinical social worker in private practice in Carmel and Salinas, Calif.
"It's not all about being done or being done perfectly. If you don't get the cookies done, buy the cookies. If you find yourself with five errands, let yourself triage. Do what has to be done now versus what can be done later. If you don't get it all done, just say, 'Oh well. It's all good.' "
To simplify gift-giving, Wolfe recommends starting a "Secret Santa" tradition or drawing a name. That way, you can focus on a thoughtful gift for one person rather than burning yourself out buying gifts for too many people. In addition, she said it's important that people sit down and decide on a financial limit for how much they want to spend — and then stick to it.
"I have a girlfriend who said this year she's only going to make it, bake it or take it — or for goodness sake," said Wolfe. "For 'make it,' you could make coupons for raking leaves or washing a truck. 'Take it' could be photos, and 'for goodness sake,' you could donate to a charity. Especially for older people, we don't need stuff — we need practical help."
Rather than pining for an illusion of how the perfect holiday should be or how holidays used to be, Wolfe suggested that people focus on what the holiday means to them. When you find yourself speeding in your car or racing through the shopping mall, she recommends that you slow down and take a few deep breaths. "Remember what the holiday means to you. If it means love and family, keep asking yourself, 'Am I on my target?' "
Just because you stay on target with your holiday focus, however, doesn't mean that other people will. Wolfe said that in relationships with other people it's especially important to keep your expectations realistic.
"Every family has challenging family members in their own unique way," said Wolfe. "So I suggest flow. Don't bite, don't hook — flow. Uncle Joe or Aunt Nelly may say or do things you don't like, but just breathe. Feel grateful that you have family. That's so important. Just observe, notice. Think everyone's doing the best they can with what they have."
If a family member becomes hurtful or abusive, however, Hills recommends firm yet respectful language to set a boundary. And, if that doesn't work, walk away.
"If someone repeatedly says something disrespectful, give yourself an exit strategy," said Hills. "If there is an unhealthy situation, it's always OK to walk away. It's each of our own responsibilities to take care of our feelings."
Time for self-care
The experts agree that taking care of yourself is the single most important thing you can do to enjoy the holiday season.
"People are not as hooked into their own program of self-care as they are at other times of year," said Lyon. "When people turn to food and alcohol, that means they aren't conscious of what their true needs are. Maybe they need a nap or a bath — or maybe they need to talk something out with someone."
She added that when planning your holiday schedule, it's important to make time for self-care — especially exercise, which lowers levels of stress hormones. "Anticipate how you can take care of your needs. How can you limit contact with problematic people and set boundaries? Can you eat healthy snacks ahead of time so you're not overeating? People forget that they need to be as present for themselves as they are for others."

description.hltext_display: National Junior Beta Club inductees
description.content:
Neighbor News (Denville Edition)
St. Mary’s Prep in Denville inducted students into the National Junior Beta Club, the national organization that recognizes academic achievement, leadership, character and service. The 2010-2011 officers are Christopher Benfante, president; Devin Lattuga, vice president; Samantha Steele, secretary; Arthur Kania, treasurer; John Stemkowski, entertainment committee head chair and Jack Pietrucha, program committee head chair. Committee members are: Annie Baier, Katie Clancy, Kyle Colin, Alicia Deluna, Marcella Franklin, Rachel Mills, Jessica Onorati, Kristen Onorati, Paul Onorati and Patrick Rush.
PHOTO COURTESY OF MARY KELSON

description.hltext_display: North Haledon home health aide ...
description.content:
FRANKLIN LAKES — A home health aide from North Haledon has been charged with stealing and forging checks from a 91-year-old disabled borough woman in her care, police said.
Johanna Delcruzthen, 30, allegedly stole six checks while working at the woman’s home, police said.
Police began an investigation Nov. 29 when the woman reported that a number of checks had been stolen from her house and cashed, said Franklin Lakes Detective Lt. John Bakelaar.
Bakelaar said that a friend of the woman noticed that the checks were missing and notified the woman’s bank. Officials there said the checks apparently were forged, he said.
Delcruzthen is employed by the Metropolitan Home Health Care of New Jersey in Saddle Brook, Bakelaar said.
During the investigation, police found evidence that Delcruzthen stole a check from an elderly Saddle Brook man, Bakelaar said.
Franklin Lakes authorities charged Delcruzthen with six counts of forgery and theft. Saddle Brook authorities charged her with forgery and theft.
Delcruzthen was released on $1,500 bail from the Bergen County Jail on Tuesday, pending a court hearing, Bakelaar said.

description.hltext_display: 腾讯《QQ西游》灵桃现世 群妖疯抢

description.content:
妖风来袭，媚惑天下，《QQ西游》开放性测试仿佛“冬天里的一把火”，让徜徉于西游世界的众妖们如痴如醉。如今众仙齐聚的天界嘉年华“蟠桃盛会”拉开帷幕。
点亮尊贵图标 妖人共享仙界蟠桃
《西游记》中孙悟空将王母娘娘的蟠桃大会搅得天翻地覆，并顺便把“三千年开花，三千年结果，三千年成熟”的蟠桃一次吃到吐。这样经典的桥段不仅让期盼了多年的神仙们头痛不已，更让众妖对于神秘的灵桃充满了期待。西游众妖则不必望眼欲穿，只要达到《QQ西游》图标点亮标准，灵桃就会闪耀出炫目的光芒，彰显妖人神通广大的仙界气质。
华丽七十二变 打造3D妖媚经典
蟠桃大会究竟何时开启？小妖们早已垂涎三尺热切期盼很久啦。《QQ西游》历经多次测试的华丽七十二变，随着开放性测试的开启，图标点亮功能也正式上线。《QQ西游》极具3D网游王者之风，并将东方魔幻风格凸显得更加淋漓尽致，相信开放性测试之后的西游世界，带给大家的是更具震撼的视听体验。
群妖争奇斗艳 展现别样文化氛围
《西游记》中的诸多场景成为玩家们儿时的经典记忆，《QQ西游》以原著为蓝本倾力打造出气势恢宏的3D极乐世界。三打白骨精还不过瘾，就到牛魔的洞穴中大闹一番；七十二变小试牛刀，再飞天遁地大展拳脚；还可以取个妖精做老婆，齐心协力勇闯八十一难。日趋完美的《QQ西游》形成了独具特色的妖性文化氛围，做一个惩恶扬善的小妖，已经成为最fashion的潮流之选。
蟠桃盛宴恢弘开启，尊贵图标点亮，体验别具一格的妖性文化，感受丰富多彩的娶精之旅，《QQ西游》开放性测试精彩呈现，绝对不容错过！《QQ西游》：娶个妖精做老婆??腾讯3D极乐世界《QQ西游》官方网站：http://qqxy.qq.com

description.hltext_display: Better Control Titleist 909 D3 Driver Review
description.content:
Titleist drivers tend to have a following which often is comprised of better players with lower handicaps. Back in the day, if you were playing Titleist golf clubs, you probably knew what you were doing. With the advent of larger, more forgiving heads, many companies had offerings that were appropriate for a larger segment of golfers.
The Titleist 909 D3 Driver is aimed at the low handicapper who wants to control ball flight, accuracy and workability whilst enjoying unparalled sound and feel. The 909 D3 driver has a 440CC sized, titanium clubhead in a classic pear shape incorporating a deep clubface. The clubface insert has been designed to maximise the energy transfer across the clubface and rear sole ridges combine with two distinctive trapezoid shapes across the centre of the club to reduce vibration and create a fantastic impact sound. The Titleist 909 D3 Driver signals Titleist's first use of a titanium Blind Bore hosel that secures the shaft of the club within the neck and offers both stability and flexibility across the whole range of 909 D3 shaft options. A swingweight screw in the rear of the 909 D3 sole allows for any weight differences when different shafts are custom fitted. The 909 D3 driver offers the lower handicapper a perfectly fitted driver that offers complete control from the tee.
In short, the classic Titleist pear shape stays intact, and a deeper face of the Titleist 909 D3 Driver gives the better player very attractive golf clubs to look at before the ball is hit. The deeper face will also allow for more choices in shot shaping, especially when hitting a fade or a lower shot into the wind.

description.hltext_display: Friend remembers alleged Y shooter as 'a protector'
description.content:
The Montclair Times
of The Montclair Times
display story on 1 page Page 1 2 >>
As a jury considers whether Kenneth Duckett is guilty of first-degree murder for the 2008 shooting of Monica Paul, an old friend of both the victim and the suspect called the slaying "a great loss on both sides."
STAFF PHOTO BY ADAM ANIK
Fuquan LaPread talks to a Times reporter about Kenneth Duckett.
Fuquan "Rocjoc" LaPread, 33, a Montclair native, grew up on Maple Avenue across from Paul and was best friends since early childhood with one of Duckett's cousins.
He came to the Essex County Veterans Courthouse in Newark on Tuesday when he heard the jury might render a verdict in the case.
LaPread, now of New Brunswick, went through Montclair's public schools with Paul, who he remembered as "a sweetheart" and "an angel" - a beauty who, despite her good looks, was sweet and approachable.
"She would give everybody a chance" as a friend, recalled LaPread. "She loved anybody. She was just beautiful." At Montclair High School, Paul "was perceived as one of the pretty girls who was nice, so people weren't afraid to speak to her," he said.
But LaPread also has fond memories of Duckett. When LaPread was young, Duckett - who is six years older than him - acted as "a protector" and "an older brother" to him, reprimanding him whenever he found LaPread hanging out on Montclair's New Street, where drugs were regularly sold. Duckett would tell his cousin and LaPread to take a hike and go to a park, trying to steer them away from gangsters and from life on the streets.
That was "the only time I saw him being aggressive or stern," LaPread said. "I never heard of him inflicting any kind of hurt on anybody."
"He was a good person, man," he said of Duckett, who has been accused of shooting Paul at close range in front of their 11-year-old daughter on June 26, 2008 in the Montclair YMCA Family Center.
LaPread was in disbelief when the mother of his now 13-year-old son told him about the tragedy. He was doing time for a drug conviction in Bayside State Prison in Leesburg when he got the news, which brought him to tears.
"When it happened, it caught me off guard," said LaPread, who told The Times "that wasn't [Duckett's] character. That wasn't him."
Released from prison in June 2009 - a year after Paul was killed - LaPread acknowledged that he had gone into a life of crime, starting off by stealing cars in Newark, despite Duckett's attempts to help him avoid that fate.
But LaPread couldn't claim he had no positive influences from older people trying to send him in a better direction.
"I don't have one of those excuses," LaPread noted. "I had guys like him [Duckett] around."
Considering how much Duckett seemed to care about LaPread's future and well-being when he was a boy, he said he could not imagine Duckett as a purposeful killer.
"He's not no cold-blooded murderer like that, to disregard all those kids. He was too instrumental in trying to keep us out of trouble," LaPread said. "He wasn't that type of person."
LaPread said the scenario being put forward by the defense, in which Duckett snapped during a sudden, uncontrollable rage compounded by pre-existing problems in his life, was plausible to him.
"In an instant, stuff happens," he said. "That was no premeditated, planned thing. That was..." he trailed off, snapping his fingers.
The jury started deliberating whether Duckett is guilty of murder, aggravated manslaughter or reckless manslaughter on Monday at 4 p.m. Court ended at 4:30 that day, and deliberations resumed this morning.
Police allege that Duckett entered the Family Center on Glenridge Avenue at about 6:30 p.m. June 26, 2008 and had words with Paul, 31, who was in the Y's pool-observation room with her and Duckett's daughter, 11-year-old Essence. Mother and daughter were watching Essence's brother, Noah, take a swimming lesson.
After speaking with Paul briefly, the suspect walked away from her, she muttered something, then Duckett turned around and asked, "You think you're tough?" He then pulled from his waistband an illegal .357 Smith & Wesson revolver - which he bought on the streets of Newark in 2007 for $500 - and shot Paul six times at close range, according to witnesses.

"She would give everybody a chance" as a friend, recalled LaPread. "She loved anybody. She was just beautiful." At Montclair High School, Paul "was perceived as one of the pretty girls who was nice, so people weren't afraid to speak to her," he said.
But LaPread also has fond memories of Duckett. "He was a good person, man," he said of Duckett, who has been accused of shooting Paul at close range in front of their 11-year-old daughter on June 26, 2008 in the Montclair YMCA Family Center.
LaPread was in disbelief when the mother of his now 13-year-old son told him about the tragedy. He was doing time for a drug conviction in Bayside State Prison in Leesburg when he got the news, which brought him to tears.
"When it happened, it caught me off guard," said LaPread, who told The Times "that wasn't [Duckett's] character. That wasn't him."

Considering how much Duckett seemed to care about LaPread's future and well-being when he was a boy, he said he could not imagine Duckett as a purposeful killer.
"He's not no cold-blooded murderer like that, to disregard all those kids. He was too instrumental in trying to keep us out of trouble," LaPread said. "He wasn't that type of person."
LaPread said the scenario being put forward by the defense, in which Duckett snapped during a sudden, uncontrollable rage compounded by pre-existing problems in his life, was plausible to him.
"In an instant, stuff happens," he said. "That was no premeditated, planned thing. That was..." he trailed off, snapping his fingers.
The jury started deliberating whether Duckett is guilty of murder, aggravated manslaughter or reckless manslaughter on Monday at 4 p.m. Court ended at 4:30 that day, and deliberations resumed this morning.
Police allege that Duckett entered the Family Center on Glenridge Avenue at about 6:30 p.m. June 26, 2008 and had words with Paul, 31, who was in the Y's pool-observation room with her and Duckett's daughter, 11-year-old Essence. Mother and daughter were watching Essence's brother, Noah, take a swimming lesson.
After speaking with Paul briefly, the suspect walked away from her, she muttered something, then Duckett turned around and asked, "You think you're tough?" He then pulled from his waistband an illegal .357 Smith & Wesson revolver - which he bought on the streets of Newark in 2007 for $500 - and shot Paul six times at close range, according to witnesses.
Duckett left the Y, fled back to his home in Orange in a Jeep driven by another man, and soon thereafter escaped to New York City, where he wandered around the Bronx and Harlem, living on the streets for days with a homeless man.
Duckett eventually returned to Brooklyn, where he had at one point resided and where he has relatives.
Following a manhunt that lasted 12 days, police found Duckett in an apartment on Troy Avenue in Flatbush.
Contact Dan Prochilo at prochilo@montclairtimes.com

description.hltext_display: Shooting under investigation
description.content:
Morris County Prosecutor Robert A. Bianchi, Esq. and Rockaway Township Police Chief Walt Arden announced that on Thursday, Dec. 9, at approximately 6:21 p.m., The Rockaway Township Police Department received a 911 call reporting a shooting at a residence within the Townsquare Village complex located on Mt. Pleasant Avenue in Rockaway Township.
The Rockaway Township Police Department along with the Morris County Prosecutor's Office Major Crime Unit and the Morris County Sheriff's Office Criminal Investigations Unit responded.
Upon the arrival of the responding patrol units, they came in contact with a 46-year-old female resident who suffered injuries sustained as a result of a shooting which is believed to be from a shotgun. The weapon was discharged from outside the residence, striking the victim who was inside her residence. The victim was transported to Morristown Memorial Hospital where she is in stable condition being treated for non life-threatening injuries.
The investigation is in progress by the Morris County Prosecutor's Office Major Crime Unit, Rockaway Township Police Department and the Morris County Sheriff's Office Criminal Investigations Section.
Morris County Prosecutor Robert A. Bianchi stated, "While this incident appears not to be random, but against this victim specifically, we are still asking people to be vigilant. I have along with Chiefs Arden and Schievella, as well as, a team of attorneys and detectives from the MCPO and Rockaway Township PD have been working on this case since the shooting occurred. We have been interviewing witnesses, collecting forensic evidence and aggressively pursuing leads."
Anyone who has information is asked to call the Rockaway Township Police Department at 973-625-4000, Morris County Prosecutor's Office at 973)-85-6200 or the Morris County Sheriff's Office Crime Stopper Program at 973-COPCALL.

description.hltext_display: 潍坊7旬老人猝死理发店 店家专供色情服务(图)
description.content:
12月17日下午，一名七旬老人在城区虞河路上的一家美容美发店猝死。19日，记者对此事进行了采访，但多方努力仍未联系到死者家属和美容美发店老板。医护人员表示，老人猝死的原因暂无法确定，需要申请做尸检后才能出结果。美容美发店附近几家沿街门头房的工作人员表示，这家美容美发店疑似提供色情服务。
事件七旬翁命殒美容美发店
据报料人称，17日下午，一名老家东北、目前居住在潍坊的七旬老人在城区虞河路上一家美容美发店内猝死，原因不明。
接电话后，记者马上来到虞河路与北宫东街交叉口南侧，在路东的一排门头房中，记者找到了报料者所称的“玲玲美容美发”店。只见粉红色的招牌上写着10个黄色的字――“干洗理发刮脸洗面踩背”。此时，店门已被一把红色的钢锁锁住。
记者在附近的沿街门头房采访获悉，17日下午，的确有一名老人进了这家美容美发店，被救护车拉走时就已死亡。
一家米线店的葛女士说：“17日下午1时15分左右，我和丈夫准备坐下吃饭，看见有救护车开过来。我们就出去看，只见一会儿工夫，一名老人就被人从美容美发店里抬了出来。刚开始我以为他只是发了病昏迷了，后来听说已经死了。”
葛女士说，救护车走时，美容美发店里的一个女服务员陪着去了医院，另外一个女服务员跟一个男青年一起把门锁上了，后来他们两人就一直在附近呆着。大约过了半个小时，去医院的服务员回来了，民警也来了。民警在现场看了看，后来便带两个女服务员走了。
随后，记者找到了门头房的房东蒋女士。蒋女士表示房子是她丈夫谭先生出租的。她只知道租房的是一对夫妻，都是东北人。蒋女士表示自己并不知道对方的电话号码，其丈夫外出，电话一直关机。
记者经多方努力，同样未能联系上死者家属。
医院老人送来时就没了呼吸
记者又赶至潍坊医学院附属医院急诊科。一位护士表示，17日下午正巧是她值班。被送来的这名老人“胖胖的”，后来被证实姓蒋，71岁，东北人。
该护士说：“老人送过来的时候就没有了呼吸，来之前就死了。当时医院已经按照常规流程进行抢救了，比如心肺复苏等，一直从下午1时20分抢救到3时多，但是恢复不过来也没办法。”至于具体原因，院方表示暂时不能下结论，需要申请做尸检才能确定。
紧接着，记者又来到奎文公安分局大虞派出所。一名值班民警表示，他并不了解这件事。由于当天出警的民警不在所内，因此详细情况无法进行查询。
探访店家疑似提供色情服务
采访中不少附近的门头房工作人员质疑这家“玲玲美容美发”店疑似提供色情服务。
记者走近美容美发店，透过玻璃门看到，店内一张黄色木桌上有几根黑色电线，细看才发现是桌面上摆放的两个黑色小型音箱的电线，除此之外便是些杂物。在店内并未看到有理发剪、吹风机等理发工具以及任何烫发工具。在一张破旧的黑色沙发背后还挂着黄色的窗帘，里面隐约可以看到摆有一张床。由于窗帘半遮，只能看到床单的颜色是天蓝色的。
美容美发店附近的一家店的老板告诉记者，这家店转到现在的老板手里近半年了，转过来后连以前店的招牌都没有换。他说：“以前那家店确实提供理发服务，但自从转到现在的老板手里后，我就再没见过里面有理发的。”该老板说，这家美容美发店刚开业的时候生意很不错。当记者问及美容美发店经营的业务时，老板隐晦地笑了笑说“是另类行业”，并且表示“不理发，根本就没有理发这回事”。
该老板还表示：“自从该店开张以来，我们时常看到白天有店员站在店门口街边，朝男性路人打手势，叫路人进店。当初还有人举报过这家店，这方式太明显了。”

description.hltext_display: Police Blotter: Parsippany, Dec. 22
description.content:
at 11:11 p.m. to investigate reports of a woman screaming profanities and threatening the hotel staff. Upon arrival at the scene, officers heard screaming and banging in the lobby coming from one of the guest rooms. According to police, Denise A. Trippler, 53, of Parsippany, then began screaming profanities at the officers and banging on the walls. She was arrested and taken to police headquarters where she was processed and later released to the custody of a family member. She was charged with disorderly conduct, obstructing the administration of law and harassment.
Heather Conklin, 29, of Dingmans Ferry, PA, was arrested on Dec. 10 at 10:17 p.m., and charged with driving while intoxicated after she was stopped by Ptl. Ross Cooper on Rt. 10 east near the intersection of Harrison Rd. Officer Cooper was conducting a traffic enforcement detail on Rt. 10 when the vehicle in question passed his location traveling 77 mph in a 50 zone. She was processed and later released pending a court appearance. Conklin was also issued a summons for the speeding violation.
Dumpster fire
While conducting a property check at the Parsippany Shopping Plaza at 360 Rt. 46 west on Dec. 11 at 1:43 a.m., Officer Robert Smolen observed flames emanating from a trash Dumpster on the property. He quickly notified police headquarters by radio and requested fire units to respond. District 5 Fire arrived at the scene and quickly extinguished the fire. The incident is currently under investigation as being suspicious. Anyone with information regarding the incident is urged to call the Parsippany Police Department at 973-263-7176.
Possession of handgun
While conducting radar enforcement on Knoll Road on Dec. 15 at 7:56 p.m., Officer Matthew Lamanna stopped a 1993 Oldsmobile near Mara and Van Wyck Roads in the Knoll Gardens apartment complex when it was clocked on radar traveling at a high rate of speed. While driver Emmanuel Udoh, 18, of Lake Hiawatha, was retrieving driving credentials, Officer LaManna observed what appeared to be a handgun on the floor of the rear passenger’s side. The officer retrieved a Walther PPS .6mm air soft pistol containing several blue plastic BB’s in the magazine. Udoh did not have a firearm’s identification card. He was arrested and transported to headquarters where he was charged with possession of a handgun, speeding and violation of a probationary license. Judge Leslie Silver authorized Udoh’s release without bail.
A charge is merely an accusation, and the defendants are presumed innocent unless proven guilty. All of the information is provided by the police departments.

description.author: India Forex Advisors
description.content:
Dollar recovered some ground as focus turned back to Europe's sovereign-debt problems after Moody's Investors Service said it would consider downgrading Portugal EUR/USD: The Euro is currently trading at 1.3134 levels and it touched low of 1.3072 levels yesterday. Immediate support comes at 1.3055 levels (21days Daily lower Bollinger) and next 1.2970, while resistance comes at 1.3220 levels & next 1.3400 levels. EURINR (59.38) exporters cover near 60.00- 60.40 levels and importers cover between 59.20- 59.40 levels. EUR/INR is likely to trade in the range of 59.25 - 59.55 today. Short term and Medium term: Bearish.
GBP/USD: The Pound is currently trading at 1.5480 levels and it touched low of 1.5434 after November UK Public borrowing increased to GBP22.8bn vs. 8.6BN previously. Immediate resistance comes near 1.5530 and next 1.5636 levels (200 Days daily EMA), while support comes at 1.5280. GBPINR (69.90) Exporters cover near 70.60 - 71.00 levels and importers cover between 69.80 -70.00 levels. GBPINR is likely to trade in the range of 69.80 - 70.10 today. Short Term and Medium Term: Neutral.
USD/JPY: USD/JPY is currently trading at 83.77 levels. BOJ left policy unchanged, as expected while Japan's all-industry index declined by 0.2% in October. Trade Balance
AUD/USD: The Aussie is currently trading at 0.9966 levels. Yesterday Aussie had hovered near the parity levels by making a high at 0.9993 and a low of 0.9946 levels. Overall the AUD/USD traded with a low of 0.9862 and a high of 0.9973. Leading Index m/m came at 0.3% vs. Previous 0%. Immediate support comes at 0.9870 levels (21 Daily EMA) While immediate resistance is at 1.0000 levels. Exporters are suggested to book Dec and Jan month's exposure above the parity levels, and Importers can cover their exposure on dips. Medium term: Bullish DOLLAR INDEX: Dollar Index is currently trading near the resistance level of 80.50 levels. Looking Ahead today, Final GDP

description.hltext_display: Obama signing 'don't ask, don't tell' repeal
Police Blotter: Denville, Dec. 22
description.content:
Neighbor News (Denville Edition)
Warrant arrests
Denville Police responded to a minor car accident on Bald Knob Road on Dec. 13 and determined that the driver, Ramon Rosario, 28, of Tamiment, Pa., had two active ATS warrants, one from Union City for $296 and one from Elmwood Park for $89. Rosario was arrested and later released after posting full bail.
On Dec. 11, John Anthony, 52, of Oxford, was arrested during a motor vehicle stop for an outstanding warrant from Clinton Twp. of $190. He was taken to police headquarters for processing and released after posting bail.
On Dec. 12, at 3:30 a.m., police found Ryan M. Frauenheim, 25, of Succasunna, sleeping in his truck in the Sogo restaurant parking lot. While talking to Frauenheim, police found he had an active $350 warrant from Bryam. He was arrested and take to police headquarters for processing. Frauenheim was able to post bail and released.
Police stopped a vehicle on Rt. 46 east, near the Sunocco gas station on Dec. 11 at about 4:23 a.m., and determined that the driver, Shannon M. Schinzel, 21, of Hopatcong, had multiple warrants for her arrest from Roxbury and Netcong, totaling $854. She was arrested and taken to police headquarters where a bail bondsman posted bail on her behalf. Before being released, Schinzel was issued a summons for driving with an expired registration.
Gemay Ramirez, 42, of Morristown, was stopped by Denville Police on Rt. 10 east on Dec. 11 at 1:30 a.m. where police found Ramirez to be intoxicated. He was arrested and taken to police headquarters where he was charged with driving while intoxicated, reckless and careless driving and failure to maintain lane.
Marijuana possession
Dorani S. Stewart, 21, of Paterson, was stopped on Rt. 46 west on Dec. 10 at 10:56 p.m. for a motor vehicle violation. Subsequent investigation revealed that Stewart was in possession of marijuana and had two active warrants for his arrest out of Paterson. He was arrested at the scene and his car impounded. Stewart was charged with possession of less than 50 grams of marijuana and possession of a controlled dangerous substance in a motor vehicle, driving with a suspended license, suspended registration, failure to maintain lamps, and unlicensed driver. Stewart was released on his own recognizance pending a court appearance in both Denville and Paterson Municipal Courts.
A charge is merely an accusation, and the defendants are presumed innocent unless proven guilty. All of the information is provided by the police departments.

possession of less than 50 grams of marijuana

description.hltext_display: Reverse Cell Phone Lookup
description.author: mitchkeys
description.content:
Posted Dezember 22nd, 2010 by mitchkeys
Do you often wonder if your significant other is having an affair? Are they suddenly unavailable or not taking calls in front of you? Did you used to spend all your time together, but now you barely hang out? Have random unknown numbers started popping up on their caller ID? If any of these actions are taking place in your relationship, chances are that you are very suspicious of your significant other. Luckily, there is a way to track a cell phone number and identify who the number belongs too. A Reverse Phone Lookup mobile phone number look up search can match a number to a name and possibly more information. Reverse Phone Lookup - Reverse Cell Phone Number Look up & Reverse Tele phone Number Look up Search
user posted image
Don't have much information available yet? No problem. By performing a basic Free Reverse Lookup of a telephone number, you can start to gather more information about a person. One of the most common (and popular) ways to find out information about someone is by doing a Reverse Lookup Directory on their phone number. Doing a Reverse Lookup Directory means that you take a phone number that you already have (or don't recognize) and look for the number owner and his or her address online. You'll be able to find out who owns the Cell Reverse Lookup
number and where they live. By performing a Reverse Phone Look Up Directory, you can begin to gather more information about a person on whom you want to perform a background check.
In case you are looking to find a mysterious phone number which keeps popping on the screen of your cell phone then the most obvious choice in your hand is to try and seek its true identity by calling up the concerned phone directories. By calling up the public directories, you can easily hope to find the name as well as the contact address of your mysterious caller. In case you are getting calls from a landline number then using public directories would prove to be the most suitable option for you. But when the calls are coming from a mobile phone number, you need to be very careful because owing to privacy reasons, cell phone numbers are not listed in public directories. Henceforth, if the number that you are about to trace is a cell phone number then you would never be able to reveal its true identity by calling up public directories. The reason is simply the lack of records maintained by public directories pertaining to numbers that are allocated to cellular phones.
If you need to find out the owner of a car then you can use a Free Reverse Phone Lookup License Plate to accomplish this task. There can be many reasons that you would want to get this information for instance if you got hit by another driver and they took off and the only thing that you have is the license plate number then you can use there number to find out who they are. Also you may be driving and see someone who is driving all over the road they may even appear to be driving drunk and then you can write down there license number and find out who they are.

The expense is low, specifically when you sign up for a "membership" option. Pretty much all you have to do is pay for a once-off cost and afterward you are able to run a search when you would like to online. It is much easier than having to pay every time.
To use Reverse Phone Lookup cell phone lookup service, you need not be a technical geek; neither do you need to have extensive information about the software. Besides, by seeking the service of a paid Reverse Phone Lookup cell phone search website, you won't be stuck with too much paperwork, when furnishing the prospect's contact information. description.hltext_display: Bergen Regional Med Center cutting up to 50 jobs
description.content:
Bergen Regional Medical Center said Tuesday that it will eliminate "less than 50 positions" as a result of federal and state reimbursement reductions for charity care and a prohibition against entering into contracts with managed health care providers.
Donnalee Corrieri, a spokeswoman for the Bergen Regional LP, a division of Solomon health management of Colorado, said in a statement that "no direct patient hospital services have been eliminated," but she declined to provide a specific number of positions or comment on what types of jobs would be cut at the Paramus hospital.
Corrieri placed partial blame for the layoffs with the hospital's title-holder, the Bergen County Improvement Authority, for not allowing it to "enter into managed-care contracts, adding more financial challenges to an already difficult reimbursement environment."
Keith Furlong, the spokesman for the improvement authority, said in a press release that Philip Wilson, the authority's new chairman, did not learn of the layoff plan until Tuesday morning.
Furlong said the hospital's management had also submitted its budget Tuesday morning — "after repeated requests" — and that the budget showed that the company continues to make a profit.
Without having managed-care contracts with private health insurance providers, hospitals typically have a more difficult time attracting patients who are privately insured, and thus tend to serve a larger proportion of less-affluent patients who are publicly insured through Medicaid and Medicare.
"Bergen Regional Medical Center, being a safety net hospital and one of the largest providers of charity care in the state, has provided medical and mental health care services to an increased number of patients without insurance while experiencing significant, multimillion-dollar reductions in reimbursements for treatment of indigent and uninsured patients," Corrieri said in the press release.
Furlong said the BCIA "cannot arbitrarily create another full-service, managed-care hospital without careful thought and review."
"Managed care is one of many topics we have tried to settle with BRMC," Furlong said in his press release.
"However, given the mission of the hospital is to be a safety net, opening up another full-service hospital in the area may jeopardize the care received by those who need it the most and can't afford to go to [Hackensack University Medical Center], Englewood [Hospital and Medical Center] or other area hospitals."
Furlong urged the company to open its books to the public and to use some of its profits to avert the layoffs.
A spokeswoman for the Health Professional and Allied Employees union said the layoffs represent about $8 million in cuts.
Jeanne Otersen, the statewide policy director for the union, noted that while Bergen Regional is privately managed, it is still publicly owned, and that the hospital should be more forthcoming with details.
"What is the impact on patients?" she said. "Are these management positions? Are these patient-care positions? Are these housekeeping positions? The lack of information is as disturbing as these cuts."

description.hltext_display: Nigeria evacúa personal diplomático de Costa de Marfil tras ataque a embajada
description.content:
Lagos, 22 dic (EFE).- Nigeria ha evacuado a su personal diplomático de Costa de Marfil, después de que la embajada nigeriana en Abiyán fuera atacada, informaron hoy los medios locales.
El ministro de Exteriores nigeriano, Odein Ajumogobia, dijo anoche en Abuya que Nigeria trabaja para evacuar al resto de sus ciudadanos que se encuentran en Costa de Marfil, sin explicar quien y cuando llevó a cabo el ataque a la Embajada ni otros detalles.
Nigeria ocupa la Presidencia de turno de la Comunidad Económica de los Estados de África Occidental (CEDEAO) y está implicada en la resolución del conflicto postelectoral de Costa de Marfil.
El conflicto se inició tras la segunda vuelta de los comicios presidenciales del pasado 28 de noviembre, al negarse Laurent Gbagbo a abandonar la Presidencia, tras diez años en el poder, pese a que la Comisión Electoral Independiente dio como ganador a su rival, Alassane Ouattara, reconocido por la comunidad internacional.
Gbagbo recurrió al Consejo Constitucional, que copan sus partidarios, que anuló los resultados en siete departamentos donde Ouattara tenía amplia mayoría y le dio la victoria, lo que no han admitido la oposición ni la comunidad internacional.
Costa de Marfil está al borde de la reanudación de la guerra civil, que ya dividió el país de 2002 a 2007, con el sur controlado por los militares leales a Gbagbo y el norte por las Fuerzas Nuevas, que no se desarmaron tras las conflagración.
En un cumbre extraordinaria, celebrada el pasado 7 de diciembre en Abuya, los líderes de la CEDEAO, encabezados por el presidente nigeriano, Goodluck Jonathan, suspendieron a Costa de Marfil, respaldaron la victoria de Outtara y exigieron a Gbabgbo que dejara pacíficamente el poder para facilitar la transición.
Posteriormente, una delegación de alto rango de la Unión Africana (UA) y la CEDEAO viajó a Abiyán para entrevistarse con Ouattara y Gbagbo y entregó a este último una carta de Jonathan en la que le comunicaba las resoluciones de la cumbre.
El grupo regional tiene prevista una nueva cumbre extraordinaria para el viernes próximo en Abuya, con el fin de estudiar la situación de Costa de Marfil y adoptar medidas al respecto.
Además de la CEDEAO, la UA, la ONU, la Unión Europea, Estados Unidos, Francia y otros países han reconocido expresamente la victoria de Ouattara, ratificada por la Operación de Naciones Unidas en Costa de Marfil, e impuesto sanciones personales a Gbabgbo y su entorno. EFE

description.hltext_display: Schools to share official for a year
description.content:
The Northvale and Harrington Park school districts will share a business administrator beginning in July, a move that the districts' superintendents say could save taxpayers tens of thousands of dollars.
Vincent Occhino, who has been Northvale's interim business administrator since September, will be doing the job for both schools for one year, Northvale Superintendent Bert Ammerman said. The 2011-12 school year will help officials determine whether having one business administrator for the two districts is worth doing permanently.
"The idea behind it is to save money, be cost-effective and still have quality work," Ammerman said, adding that if the plan works, it could save each district $70,000 to $75,000 a year.
Occhino, who was assistant superintendent for finance and school board secretary for the Pascack Valley Regional High School District until retiring in June, will evaluate the system, he said, and report to the two boards of education late next year or in early 2012 about the feasibility of the practice.
With Occhino's 30 years of experience as a school business administrator and his status as an interim administrator for the district, Ammerman said, he can properly make an independent evaluation of the plan.
Ammerman said he and Harrington Park Superintendent Adam Fried had been talking about sharing a business administrator for about a year, and are both comfortable with having Occhino in the role. Both boards are supportive, he said.
Harrington Park's business administrator is an interim hire whose term will end in June, and the districts can retain Occhino for another year.
"It works out perfectly for all of us," Fried said.
The support staff in the school districts will remain the same, Ammerman said.
Occhino will perform all of the duties for both jobs, including attending board meetings, overseeing district finances and preparing both budgets to determine whether the job can be done by one person.
Occhino said that he will go into the position with an open mind, and that he thinks he will be able to provide a fair assessment of the experiment.
"For us, it's continuing the tradition of this Northern Valley, and what's made it very strong is our ability to share services, and it'll be the way we survive moving forward in these difficult budget times," Fried said.

description.hltext_display: 北大副校长被教室管理员催促下课引学生热议
description.content:
本报讯 前晚10时40分许，北京大学副校长海闻上课时，被教室管理员以“锁门时间已过”为由催促下课。
学生称，海闻得知对方身份和来意后说，“教学重要还是锁门重要？”“我可以明天就让你走人”，此事在学生中引起争议，并发到北大未名BBS上。昨日，当事教室管理员称，目前工作未受影响。对此，海闻婉拒采访。
学生发帖
即将下课被教管员打断
前晚在北大未名BBS上，有学生发帖称，当晚10时40分许，副校长海闻在经济学原理课上做结束语时，一名教室管理员来到教室门口，在门口大声催促道“锁门了”。海闻在得知教管员的身份及来意后，对其说：“教学重要还是锁门重要？”随后海闻情绪有些激动，说话有些失态。
另一篇帖子称，海闻随即对该教管员说，“我告诉你，我可以明天就让你走人！”
昨日，自称目睹事发过程的学生称网帖内容属实。
学生说，事发地在理科教学楼117教室，可容纳上百人，当晚经济学原理为本学期最后一节，本应21点30分结束，但由于此前少上了一节课，便拖堂一个多小时。教管员催课时，课程已近结束，不少学生正收拾书包。
教管员
工作未受到影响
根据北大校方规定，老师上课时间到晚9时30分结束，教学楼关闭时间为晚上10时30分。
昨日，记者找到当事教管员何女士。她回忆，前晚她按规定时间锁门，“当时只有理117教室还在上课。”
何女士说，此前也经常碰到老师拖堂的情况，一般情况下，双方沟通后教管员都会等待老师讲完课，“但海闻老师的说话方式让我很下不来台，而且还用他的身份压我。”
何女士说，目前其工作未受到此事影响。
副校长
事情是有前因后果的
“事情因为一句话引起，但这是有前因后果的。”昨日，针对此事，副校长海闻表示不愿接受采访。
北大新闻中心张老师表示对此事并不知情。张老师说，老师上课时思路被打断，有点情绪是正常的，“他可能只是说了句气话，那个员工还在正常工作。”
■观点
觉得海老师是在向行政管理部门挑战，管理部门应该是为学生和教授服务的而不是僵化限制从而越轨为高高在上的衙门，难道大家不觉得北大需要“去行政化”吗？―――发帖人：zhiyang
PK
作为一个有能力影响本校管理制度的高层领导，没有想过去改变理教22点半关门的规定，却用自己的身份来为难规定的执行者，怎么看怎么不像是值得赞赏的行为。
―――发帖人：zealer
稿件来源：新京报 33

description.hltext_display: 'Uneventful' school referendum on tap
description.content:
LYNDHURST — With a $30 million school referendum just a month away, district and township officials have been taking a low-key approach as they prepare for one of the district's most important votes in recent years.
While no public forum is scheduled to discuss the details of the proposed 125,000-square-foot middle school, there have been presentations, Board of Education meetings, PTA gatherings and civic events.
"It's uneventful," schools Superintendent Tracey Stellato said. "But we've been involved in all kinds of venues."
Before schools close this week for the holiday recess, attorneys are completing building specifications and the final wording for the Jan. 25 referendum, she said.
With six elementary schools older than 80 years, officials are hoping that residents will vote in favor of the project.
In the proposal, the $37 million middle school would be funded partly by the town, which will bond $7 million as part of a shared-services agreement to use the auditorium and run the office of emergency management, recreation programs and senior programs from the school.
The same plan fell through three years ago, when the developer of the EnCap golf and housing project went bankrupt, but officials said they think voters know the advantages the town would reap by having a middle school.
"This thing is not a surprise to anyone who lives in the town," Mayor Richard DiLascio said of the revived plan.
"I don't think people need to be convinced that the quality of education in a town directly reflects in the values that people see in their homes," he said.
The 6-acre property — a sports field owned by the school district near Marin and Page avenues and Fourth Street — was bought in the 1930s for a new school and is already zoned for public use.
Proponents are hoping that voters will be persuaded to approve the plan based on today's low interest rates, low construction cost and the obvious need to upgrade facilities.
"People are realizing that you can't have a building that's 118 years old," DiLascio said. "The Lincoln School is 118 years old. What are you going to do with that building?"

description.hltext_display: My View On TaylorMade R9 SuperDeep TP Driver
description.content:
There is a fact that Taylormade R9 SuperTri Driver is scheduled to release Feb 19th 2010! It's a 460cc head with 3 movable weights and an adjustable face and will be available in a TP version. Taylormade provides two 1 gram weights and one 16 gram weight and claims a maximum of 75 yards of right to left or vice versa adjust-ability. It also features the previous R9's adjustable options like face angle open or closed which changes the effective loft as well. I hear that the adjustment sleeve has been updated but that provides no substantial gain for the player's shot, perhaps they made a new sleeve to save even further on weight. I unlike many people welcome almost all new releases by Taylormade because they push the envelope and keep their competitors on their toe's. So what if its virtually the same as the R9 except with a deeper face, my only gripe about it is of everyone I know who has an R9 very few actually adjust the club after the first several rounds.
The R9 SuperTri clubhead offers better aerodynamics than previous Taylormade drivers through a redesigned crown, a deeper face, and center of gravity that is slight more rearward compared to previous generations of R9.As early as 2004, TaylorMade Golf has been making drivers with adjustable weights. Then the company introduced the R9 series in 2008, which included movable weights and "Flight Control Technology" (FCT) - giving the golfer the option to alter face angle, loft and lie angle.
Moreover, the adjustable hosel allows you to select one of eight different loft, lie and face-angle configurations so you can pick the look at address that best suits your swing. MWT, or Moveable Weight Technology is seen in these three weight ports which are interchangeable so you can adjust the center of gravity to promote a fade, neutral or draw bias. The sleek head design of the SuperTri reduces wind drag in the downswing to increase swing speeds which translates into more distance. Inside the clubhead, Ultra-thin Wall technology reduces the wall thickness of the clubhead, relieving enough discretionary weight to allow for the implementation. The R9 SuperTri's stock shaft is the Fujikura Motore 60-gram shaft, which is lighter than shaft in previous R9 drivers. The results are a driver geared to help increase swing speed while promoting better launch conditions and more forgiveness on off-center strikes.. It shows the movable weights and the Flight Control Technology sleeve at the hosel. In a word,it is a good looking driver. I really liked the black head on it. It sounded good too. The adjustability was very impressive and responsive. I could make a click open and it would hit a tiny fade. You really can adjust your club to hit the shot you desire. I felt compared to the Nike VR tool though, that this was not as slick. We never hit it as far as the other drivers.

description.hltext_display: Newark bank agrees to dividend restrictions
description.content:
Newark-based City National Bancshares Corp., which has been under regulatory pressure to increase capital levels, entered into an agreement with the Federal Reserve Bank of New York that could restrict the bank-holding company's ability to pay dividends and make payments to bondholders.
City National agreed not to pay dividends to shareholders or make interest or other payments on subordinated debentures or trust preferred securities without the Fed's approval.
City National's main subsidiary, City National Bank of New Jersey, has been operating since June 2009 under a separate agreement with the U.S. Comptroller of the Currency to address "unsafe and unsound banking practices relating to asset quality and credit risk management.''
The OCC has said the bank needed to improve its capital ratios and seek outside capital.
Problems with non-performing commercial real estate loans have been on the rise at City National, which has eight offices in New Jersey and New York, including a Paterson branch. A Hackensack office was closed this year. As of June 30, the bank had $460 million in assets.
A Fed spokeswoman said Tuesday that she "can't discuss supervisory matters.''
"We are working diligently to comply with requirements and we have made progress," City National Chief Executive Officer Louis E. Prezeau said Tuesday in a phone interview. "The bank continues to be steadfast in its mission to serve the underserved community, but we have to proceed with caution."
The Prudential Insurance Co. of America gave the bank a $5 million capital boost in late November by converting a loan it made to the holding company in 2007 into an equity stake in the bank.
Prezeau and Bob DeFillippo, a spokesman for Newark-based Prudential, declined to comment on the deal.
The bank, which received more than $9 million in Troubled Asset Relief Program funds last year, hasn't paid back any of the principal amount and missed payments of TARP dividends owed to the government this year.

event_or_fact.property: We are working diligently to comply with requirements and we have made progress; The bank continues to be steadfast in its mission to serve the underserved community, but we have to proceed with caution.
Chief Executive Officer, City National Bancshares Corp.
City National Bank of New Jersey

description.hltext_display: 腾讯《QQ西游》“妖”你梦斩龙王
description.author: www.qq.com
description.content:
全球大片《盗梦空间》引发催眠热潮，《QQ西游》邀你重回东方古典神话《西游记》，走进唐王梦境，斩下泾河龙王首级。突破3D副本单线枯燥剧情，筑建网络式立体副本，双重副本剧情选择，多种结局完美献映，《QQ西游》梦斩龙王副本引领众妖潜入深海，大战泾河龙王！幽幽水晶宫折射群妖风采，深邃未知的命运让你情不自禁身陷迷离梦境！
泾河风云突变 龙王命悬一线
泾河龙王争强好胜，为了与袁守诚的赌约之争，私自篡改下雨的时辰点数，触犯天条被判死罪。龙王托梦给唐王李世民希望刀下留情，宰相魏征左右为难。几方明争暗斗，是保全龙族血脉还是维护天庭威严？群妖妩媚登场，抉择龙王命运，梦回龙宫圣地，是铁面无私挥刀斩龙还是宅心仁厚救赎龙族？打破时空桎梏，平行剧情、双重结局“妖”你定夺！
尘封旧案再度开启 妖精审龙王
泾河龙王冤死刀下，今朝《QQ西游》欲为其翻案。开创新模式立体副本“梦斩龙王”，群妖自由选择剧情走向，面临前所未有的艰难抉择，不仅需要奋战到底的勇气，更需要理性冷静的分辨是非。你可以直接将龙王血魂就地正法，昭示天下，也可以找到李世民或者魏征领取任务，继续征程，挑战最终BOSS。玩家每一个细小的决定都将直接影响副本的结局，多层次立体展现副本剧情，亦正亦邪，妖精主宰唐王梦境！
群妖携手并战 同斩龙王共叙妖情
取“精”之路，九九八十一难，比起立地成佛更珍贵的就是妖精间生死两相照的绵绵情谊。辨曲直，斩龙王，团队共同决定副本剧情，定位命运走向，不同职业各司其职，完美配合、极限操作，群妖奋战深海龙宫，无间配合驰骋泾河龙宫！
梦斩龙王，龙宫大战三百回合，群妖续写不老神话，与天庭仙界抗衡，与人间皇权斗争，掌握自己的命运，一路妖媚西行，演绎万种妖情！《QQ西游》：娶个妖精做老婆??腾讯3D极乐世界 《QQ西游》官方网站：http://qqxy.qq.com

description.hltext_display: La Bourse de Paris stable à l'ouverture, Poweo s'envole
description.content:
PARIS (Reuters) - La Bourse de Paris a ouvert sur une note pratiquement stable alors que l'indice CAC 40 est tout proche d'effacer ses pertes de l'année et que les investisseurs préfèrent ne pas prendre de positions importantes avant la fin de l'année.
A 9h09 le CAC 40 prend 0,03%, à 3.926,44 points, après avoir ouvert en très léger repli, et se rapproche ainsi de son cours de clôture du 31 décembre, à 3.936,33 points.
Du côté des valeurs, Poweo bondit de 12,25% suite à l'annonce de la vente de ses actifs de production à Verbund, cependant qu'Hermès gagne plus de 4% après que LVMH a annoncé mardi soir détenir plus de 20% du sellier.
En revanche, Ingenico recule de 3,77%, après avoir dit mardi soir n'avoir reçu aucune offre ferme et ne mener aucune discussion sur son capital.
Les autres grandes places européennes évoluent également sur une note hésitante, Londres et Francfort prenant toutes les deux 0,05%. Du côté des indices paneuropéens, l'EuroStoxx 50 gagne 0,14% et l'EuroFirst 300 progresse de 0,19%.
L'euro prend 0,34% sur le billet vert et se négocie au-dessus de 1,31 dollar, à 1,3146 dollar.
Le baril de brut léger américain gagne 0,27%, à 90,06 dollars.
Alexandre Boksenbaum-Granier, édité par Jean-Michel Bélot

description.hltext_display: TOY DRIVE MAKES CHRISTMAS MERRY FOR ...
description.content:
CLOSTER — Military transport vehicles, box trucks and SUVs lined up Tuesday outside the Closter Fire Department, but this wasn’t an emergency. It was the culmination of this year’s PBA toy drive, with volunteers loading thousands of new toys for distribution.
AMY NEWMAN/STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER
Keith Volz of the Dumont Police Department gathering toys for one of the many social service agencies that sent staff to the Closter Fire Department on Tuesday to find Christmas gifts for clients. Fire and ambulance units, community groups and companies helped collect the presents.
"We’ve had a very successful drive this year," said Closter Patrolman Don Nicoletti, one of those helping to load the toys. "We started this with one town about 21 years ago and have now grown to 23 agencies."
PBA groups from Englewood to Franklin Lakes to Northvale and Park Ridge were involved in this year’s drive.
"It’s police run, but we have so much assistance from the community, such as corporations, businesses, the fire department and ambulance corps … everybody puts out a box to collect toys," Nicoletti said. "Paterson and Passaic churches have come out, and military families benefit through the Teaneck Armory."
Patrol officers were especially pleased, because they witness the hardships on the streets each day. This year, 15 to 20 organizations other than the military families were on hand to receive bags of toys, as were about a dozen to 15 individual families, said Closter Patrolman Vinny Aiello, a member of PBA Local 233.
More than 100 volunteers — some wearing clothing bearing the initials S.R.T, for Santa Response Team – came from towns, churches and other groups.
The toys will be delivered to military families; The Joseph M. Sanzari Children’s Hospital, Hackensack University Medical Center’s Pediatric Center and Tomorrows Children’s Fund, all at HUMC in Hackensack; West Side Infant & Teen Center; New Hope in Westwood; Bergen County Head Start Programs, and Englewood Hospital and Medical Center. Schools, aid organizations and individual families from Bergen and Passaic counties also benefit.
Patrol Officer Jeremy Luciano of Cresskill said it reinforces the work he does on a daily basis on the streets of his borough.
"We are in people’s houses and deal with people every day," said Luciano, a patrolman for 13 years. "We see there are certain people in town that we can help out."
A decade as a patrol officer has left Closter Officer Aldo Guerino with similar observations.
"There are still people here in Closter — and even though it’s upscale — some people don’t have much, and this is the way to give back to the community."
Charles Oglesby of Moving on Life Center, in Teaneck came to pick up several bags of unwrapped toys for families in crisis.
"These toys will be disseminated to children of low- and moderate-income families in the Teaneck, Hackensack and Englewood area," said Oglesby, the director of adolescent services with the holistic center. "These are kids who will really be just so glad to get these toys."
The center’s executive director, Williams Carlos Jr., of Closter, was overwhelmed by the outpouring of unwrapped toys collected, in some cases, since September from people from areas in the Northern Valley, Pascack Valley and towns from Tenafly and Oradell to Paramus and Dumont.
"People cannot fully appreciate recovery if they are suffering financially," Carlos said.
For many, it’s one less hurdle for the needy to overcome this holiday season, Carlos said.
First Sgt. Minnie Hiller-Cousins of the Army National Guard was busy filling one of two Army transport trucks from Teaneck Armory with bags of toys that will be distributed to 500 children.
"This wonderful donation helps a lot of families," she said of the children of soldiers who returned from Iraq and Afghanistan. "To bring them home and then to have a real Christmas with toys. … They don’t have to worry."
Alan Lowry of Cerebral Palsy of North Jersey and assistant principal of Horizon School in Livingston came to the firehouse to collect bags of toys for middle- and low-income families. His school serves students with multiple disabilities in Essex, Morris and Hudson counties.
"Without this organization, our kids would have an empty Christmas," he said.

description.hltext_display: 男子患怪病脆如“玻璃人” 四肢自然断裂(图)
description.content:
连永胜期盼好心人伸出援手救救他
本报四平讯 12月19日18时许，网民“眼睛寻”网上发出题为《救救他》的帖子称，伊通43岁男子连永胜得了一种怪病，双腿、手臂、锁骨、肋骨都自然断裂，无钱医治。记者根据此帖联系采访到住在医院里的连永胜，接受记者采访时，他眼含泪水用祈求的眼神看着记者，希望通过本报恳求好心人伸出援手救他一命。
怪病<<
身体多处骨折 男子变“玻璃人”
20日，记者在伊通满族自治县第一人民医院的急诊抢救室里看到了躺在病床上的连永胜，骨瘦如柴，左腿打着夹板，他的前妻高丰文和弟弟连永生在照顾他。
据连永胜讲，他家住伊通镇福安街道福安三委四组。去年9月10日，在从外地坐火车回伊通的途中，他突然感觉从脚到大腿都疼痛。到家后，他按照风湿病吃药治疗。今年6月10日，他一早起床，突然感到肋骨折了。到县第一人民医院一检查，发现多处肋骨骨折。7月23日，他到吉林大学中日联谊医院进行了检查，医生的诊断意见是：1、四肢长骨骨盆代谢异常活跃，双肾显影不清，符合超级骨显像影像学表现，考虑为甲旁亢所致的骨代谢性疾病可能性较大，全身多发骨转移瘤所致可能性较低。2、双侧肋骨及右侧锁骨水平骨盐代谢异常活跃区，考虑为多发骨折所致。
从长春回家后，连永胜继续吃壮骨的药，可是越吃病越重。8月8日，他正走路时右侧大腿断裂了，从此，他只能躺在床上。12月11日，他的左胳膊突然又折了。12月18日，他的左大腿骨也断裂了。其间，他的锁骨也骨折了。经亲朋好友网上一查，说他这种病是“玻璃人”。
“我一感到哪疼，过几天那地方就会骨折，恐怕我的右胳膊也难保住。”目前，连永胜的双腿、左臂、锁骨、肋骨等身体多处骨折。
据连永胜的弟弟连永生讲，他的父母、祖父母、外祖父母都没有人得过这种病。
无奈<<
无钱医治 只要求提供临终服务
连永胜讲，他的母亲患有脑梗塞，常年卧床不起，父亲股骨头坏死，已经11年了，家里穷得没有钱为他治病。12月16日，亲属帮忙把他送到了县医院，这4天里，没用药也没有打针，只是进行一些处置。
伊通满族自治县第一人民医院骨科医生王海峰说，连永胜为多发性骨折，因该医院没有这种病的治疗经验，家属送患者来住院时，交了200元押金，要求医院提供临终服务，医院曾建议其转入上一级医院进行手术治疗。目前只能是患者有需要时，进行对症处置。
深情<<
前妻辞掉工作来照顾他
连永胜得了怪病后饱受折磨，惟一让他感到温暖的是，今年8月，家住黑龙江塔河的前妻高丰文通电话时听说他得了重病后，辞掉了医务工作，从黑龙江来伊通照看他。“当时看到他病成这样，我的心可不好受了，就留下来照顾他。”高丰文含泪说，“尽管一起生活的那些年有吵有闹，但我们的感情很深。”
期盼<<
盼您帮一把 若治不好将捐遗体
连永胜说，他非常想站起来，希望好心医院或好心医生能为他治病，也希望能有好心的企业家为他伸出援手。但是连永胜也表示，他的病如果治不了，愿意在死后把遗体捐献给医学界进行研究，希望对以后得这种病的患者治愈有所帮助。
